Processing Text Files¶

This section explains how text processing is done using the various available functions:

  • count_words(): Count words in a file.

  • count_chars(): Count characters in a file.

  • count_lines(): Count lines in a file.

  • find_word(): Find a word in the file.

  • replace_word(): Replace a word and save the changes to a new file.

text_processor.count_chars(file_path: str) → int¶

Count the total number of characters in the file.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the file to be processed.

Returns:

The total number of characters in the file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.

text_processor.count_lines(file_path: str) → int¶

Count the total number of lines in the file.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the file to be processed.

Returns:

The total number of lines in the file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.

text_processor.count_words(file_path: str) → int¶

Count the total number of words in the specified text file.

Parameters:

file_path (str): The path to the text file.

Returns:

int: The total number of words in the file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError: If the specified file does not exist.

text_processor.find_word(file_path: str, word: str) → int¶

Find the frequency of a specific word in the file.

Parameters:

  • file_path – The path to the file to be processed.

  • word – The word to search for.

Returns:

The number of occurrences of the word in the file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.

text_processor.main()¶

Main function to handle command-line arguments and call respective functions to process the text file.

text_processor.replace_word(file_path: str, old_word: str, new_word: str, output_file: str) → str¶

Replace a specific word in the text file and save the modified content to a new file.

Parameters:

file_path (str): The path to the input text file. old_word (str): The word to be replaced. new_word (str): The word to replace with. output_file (str): The path where the modified file will be saved.

Returns:

str: The path to the new output file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError: If the specified file does not exist.
